extendedIngredients.name: chestnuts
extendedIngredients.original: 20 vacuum-packed peeled whole chestnuts, thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: vacuum-packed peeled whole chestnuts, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: thick-cut bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 6 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/4-inch dice (6 ounces)
extendedIngredients.originalName: thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/4-inch dice (6 ounces)

title: Brussels Sprouts with Chestnuts and Bacon
summary: Brussels Sprouts with Chestnuts and Bacon might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 565 calories, 20g of protein, and 35g of fat. This gluten free and primal recipe serves 4 and costs $3.76 per serving. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up rich turkey stock, vacuum-packed chestnuts, salt and pepper, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 74%. This score is good. Similar recipes are Brussels Sprouts And Chestnuts With Bacon, Brussels Sprouts with Chestnuts and Bacon, and Brussels Sprouts with Bacon and Chestnuts.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the brussels sprouts and cook until just tender, about 7 minutes. Drain well.                                              Meanwhile, in a large deep skillet, cook the bacon over moderate heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Add the butter. When the foam subsides, add the brussels sprouts and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until they are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the chestnuts and season with salt and pepper. Add the Rich Turkey Stock, simmer until heated through and serve.

steps.step: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat.
Add the brussels sprouts and cook until just tender, about 7 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large deep skillet, cook the bacon over moderate heat until crisp, about 5 minutes.
Add the butter. When the foam subsides, add the brussels sprouts and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until they are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the chestnuts and season with salt and pepper.
Add the Rich Turkey Stock, simmer until heated through and serve.
